## Chicken Marsala

![](chicken_marsala/chicken_marsala.jpg){width="300"}

### Ingredients
- $1$ pkg penne pasta
- $1 \frac{1}{2}$ lbs chicken tenderloin, tendon removed, cut into cubes
- $3$ tbsp all-purpose flour
- salt & pepper
- $1$ tbsp olive oil
- $3$ tbsp unsalted butter, divided
- $8$ oz pkg baby bella mushrooms, sliced
- $1$ medium shallot, finely chopped
- $2$ cloves garlic, minced
- $\frac{2}{3}$ cup chicken broth
- $\frac{2}{3}$ cup dry marsala wine
- $\frac{2}{3}$ cup heavy cream
- $2$ tsp chopped fresh thyme


### Directions
1. Cook pasta according to package instructions.
1. Salt and pepper the chicken to taste.  Lightly coat it with $3$  tbsp flour
1. Heat $1$ tbsp of olive oil and $2$ tablespoons of the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.  Cook the chicken. Transfer it to a plate and set aside.
1. Melt the remaining tablespoon of butter in the pan. Add the mushrooms and cook for 5 minutes. 
1. Add the chopped shallot, $2$ cloves garlic, and salt; cook for 1 to 2 minutes more. 
1. Add the $\frac{2}{3}$ cup chicken broth, Marsala wine, and heavy cream, $2$ tsp thyme, and some salt and pepper.  
1. Scrape any brown bits from the pan into the liquid. Bring the liquid to a boil and gently boil for 15 minutes until thickened.
1. Add cooked penne and chicken to the pan and fold into the Marsala sauce.
